pull_request.title: Update use-index-resource-state to deselect items that are no longer in the resource list
pull_request.body:
### WHY are these changes introduced?

Fixes [https://github.com/Shopify/web/issues/60775](https://github.com/Shopify/web/issues/60775)

Currently if someone has done something that would remove a resource then returns to the page with the resource list, there is a delay while the cache updates to remove that resource. In that time it is possible to select the resource, which is then not removed from the "selectedResources"

### WHAT is this pull request doing?

This PR adds a `useEffect` that checks for changes in the length of the available resources array and then updates the selected resources to remove anything that is no longer in the array.

### How to 🎩

🖥 [Local development instructions](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris-react/blob/master/README.md#development)
🗒 [General tophatting guidelines](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris-react/blob/master/documentation/Tophatting.md)
📄 [Changelog guidelines](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris-react/blob/master/documentation/Versioning%20and%20changelog.md)

The details on replicating/testing are available in https://github.com/Shopify/web/issues/60775.

### 🎩 checklist

- [ ] Tested on [mobile](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris-react/blob/master/documentation/Tophatting.md#cross-browser-testing)
- [ ] Tested on [multiple browsers](https://help.shopify.com/en/manual/intro-to-shopify/shopify-admin/supported-browsers)
- [ ] Tested for [accessibility](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris-react/blob/master/documentation/Accessibility%20testing.md)
- [ ] Updated the component's `README.md` with documentation changes
- [ ] [Tophatted documentation](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris-react/blob/master/documentation/Tophatting%20documentation.md) changes in the style guide
- [ ] For visual design changes, ping @ sarahill to update the Polaris UI kit

<!--
  When tophatting, please check the UNRELEASED entry for consistency, as per the [guidelines](https://github.com/Shopify/polaris-react/blob/master/documentation/Versioning%20and%20changelog.md).
-->

comment.body:
Hey @yurm04, I think it's entirely up to you! 

The described was addressed at the project level and this remained opened so the Polaris team could weigh in and decide if this was the expected behaviour or an unintended outcome. 

I'd say that the fact that this felt into oblivion is probably sign that we should just close it and wait for it to pop again in the future. Going to do just that to save you a click, but feel free to reopen if you think this is in fact relevant and I'd be happy to help push it to the goal line!

issue.title: Props table still missing for some components
issue.body:
## Issue summary

Some components are still missing their props tables. Here's a potential list of affected components:
- [Badge](https://polaris.shopify.com/components/badge)
- KeypressListener (not currently listed)
- [Tag](https://polaris.shopify.com/components/tag)
- [Textfield](https://polaris.shopify.com/components/text-field)

My best guess (without looking too deep into it) is that the fact that these components are exporting a `NonMutuallyExclusiveProps` that somehow we fail to match back to the component 🤷 

## Expected behavior
These components should have their props listed just as the rest of components

## Actual behavior
Prop tables for these are just missing 😢 

## Steps to reproduce the problem
1. Navigate to any of the aforementioned urls and verify that the props table is missing even though the components have props

PS: There seem to be related open issues at the moment (https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/issues/6371, https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/issues/6601, https://github.com/Shopify/polaris/issues/6779) but I think this one is different in nature to those other ones.
